Start Action Response: {"step_id": "dbd9706f-6ceb-4387-8946-bc0454534d64", "action": "start", "status": "completed", "result": {"recommendations": [{"title": "Surface regulatory credibility in the hero", "recommendation": "Add a hero-level trust bar with named frameworks and certifications (MiCA, AMLD5/6, MAS, FATF, GDPR, ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II) plus data residency options and links to audit reports or a Trust Center.", "tags": "Critical"}, {"title": "Replace vague CTAs with outcome-specific actions", "recommendation": "Use precise, tiered CTAs such as 'Book 15\u201330 Min Technical Demo,' 'Access Sandbox,' and 'View API Docs/Compliance Frameworks,' with microcopy clarifying what happens next and time commitment.", "tags": "Critical"}, {"title": "Create a developer-first navigation path", "recommendation": "Add a prominent 'Developers \u2013 API & Sandbox' entry with quick access to SDKs, endpoints, SLAs for regulatory updates, webhooks, and a Quick Start guide; keep these links persistent via sticky navigation.", "tags": "Significant"}, {"title": "Make proof points concrete and verifiable", "recommendation": "Replace generic stats with defined metrics and context (e.g., false-positive reduction, update cadence, jurisdictions covered), add methodology tooltips, last-updated timestamps, and independent validation references.", "tags": "Critical"}, {"title": "Expand solution cards with depth and integration signals", "recommendation": "Add 'Learn More' links to detailed docs, integration badges (REST API, webhooks, sandbox), update frequency, and coverage maps; include a comparison matrix mapping features to specific regulations.", "tags": "Significant"}, {"title": "Use real product visuals and chaptered demos", "recommendation": "Swap abstract imagery for UI screenshots or chaptered video previews labeled by use case/regime (e.g., MAS reporting, MiCA classification) with transcripts and key takeaways for fast scanning.", "tags": "Minor"}, {"title": "Strengthen social proof and credibility pathways", "recommendation": "Introduce case studies with measurable outcomes, recognizable client logos or testimonials, and a dedicated 'Customer Stories' section; ensure footer includes direct links to Case Studies, Integrations, Regulatory Coverage, and Trust Center.", "tags": "Significant"}], "ux_score": {"design_score": 74, "justification": [{"category": "Usability Heuristics", "score": 27, "max": 30, "description": "Primary value proposition and CTA are immediately visible in the hero. Navigation is standard and includes search, but some labels (e.g., Early Alpha Access) are jargon-heavy and no explicit Home link is visible. Small, low-contrast microcopy in cards/footer hints at minor readability issues."}, {"category": "Visual Design & Appeal", "score": 31, "max": 40, "description": "Strong hierarchy with a prominent hero headline and clearly segmented feature cards and metrics. Cohesive purple gradient palette with consistent button styling; however, complex hero background competes slightly with text, and some small type in cards/footer reduces typographic clarity. Components are largely consistent and polished; imagery/video is high quality and on-brand."}, {"category": "Modern UX Practices", "score": 16, "max": 30, "not_assessable": ["feedback_interactivity", "responsive_design"], "description": "Primary CTA buttons are distinct and repeated in logical sections. Information is grouped into clear sections (solutions cards, video, metrics, footer). Accessibility shows mixed signals: generally good contrast for headings and buttons but very small body text in places and some lighter text on gradients could challenge readability."}], "improvement_potential": {"high_impact": ["Increase base body text size (\u226516px) and ensure small captions in cards/metrics/footer meet WCAG contrast and legibility.", "Reduce visual noise behind hero copy (e.g., add a stronger overlay or simplify background) to improve text clarity."], "medium_impact": ["Clarify jargon in nav (e.g., label 'Early Alpha Access' with a descriptive tooltip or secondary label) and add a clear Home link/logo behavior.", "Consolidate repeated CTA sections by varying content (add brief benefits, trust badges, or a customer quote) to avoid redundancy."], "polish": ["Ensure the logo is never clipped and maintains consistent padding in the header.", "Tighten typographic scale consistency across headings/subheads; slightly increase line-height for small paragraphs.", "Add subtle dividers or consistent spacing tokens to keep vertical rhythm perfectly even across sections."]}}, "ux_laws": {"recommendations": [{"title": "Increase text contrast and size in solution cards", "recommendation": "Problem: Body copy inside the four purple feature cards (e.g., Crypto Risk Analytics, Regulatory Compliance Database) is small and low-contrast on gradients, hurting readability. Principle: WCAG contrast + Legibility; Signal-to-noise ratio; Jakob\u2019s Law for expected clarity. Action: Raise font size to 16\u201318 px minimum with 1.4\u20131.6 line-height, set text color to high-contrast (e.g., near-white on darkest shade), and place content on a solid overlay panel (95\u201398% opaque) to decouple from the gradient. Builds on expert note about small, low-contrast text.", "tags": "Critical"}, {"title": "Clarify and standardize primary CTAs", "recommendation": "Problem: Multiple CTAs (\u201cDiscover the Path\u2026\u201d, \u201cGet Started\u201d, \u201cLearn More\u201d) compete and repeat, diluting the primary goals (sign up for trial, book demo, subscribe, contact sales). Principle: Hick\u2019s Law (reduce choices), Goal-gradient effect. Action: Define one primary CTA label sitewide (e.g., \u201cBook a Demo\u201d or \u201cStart Free Trial\u201d) with a consistent style. Demote secondary actions to text links. Replace bottom repeated hero with a variant that targets another goal (e.g., \u201cSubscribe to Newsletter\u201d) to reduce redundancy. Builds on expert note about repeated CTA redundancy.", "tags": "Critical"}, {"title": "Make jargon and navigation clearer, add Home affordance", "recommendation": "Problem: \u201cEarly Alpha Access\u201d may be unclear to non\u2011experts; no explicit Home exit. Principle: Jakob\u2019s Law (match mental models), Recognition over recall. Action: Rename to \u201cRequest Early Access (Alpha)\u201d with a brief tooltip/hover note explaining eligibility. Add a persistent Home link via clicking the logo and an explicit \u201cHome\u201d item or breadcrumb on subpages. Builds on expert note about navigation clarity and home route.", "tags": "Significant"}, {"title": "Tame the hero background to boost message clarity", "recommendation": "Problem: The animated/complex hero background competes with headline/subheadline, reducing legibility and scannability. Principle: Von Restorff effect and Signal-to-noise ratio. Action: Add a semi-opaque dark scrim (e.g., 60\u201370%) behind the headline block or switch to a softer, blurred variant; shorten subheadline to one crisp sentence; keep CTA within the same grouped card. Builds on expert note about background distraction and wordiness.", "tags": "Significant"}, {"title": "Provide system status for the video block", "recommendation": "Problem: No loading/feedback if the video delays; users may think it\u2019s broken. Principle: Nielsen\u2019s Heuristic\u2014Visibility of system status. Action: Add a lightweight skeleton or spinner with \u201cLoading video\u2026\u201d and a fallback thumbnail + transcript link; ensure controls and captions are on by default. Builds on expert note about missing loading indicator.", "tags": "Significant"}, {"title": "Fix brand presentation issues (cut-off logo) and ensure tap targets", "recommendation": "Problem: The footer/hero logo appears clipped; small links and badges may be hard to tap. Principle: Aesthetic and minimalist design; Fitts\u2019s Law. Action: Adjust logo container/padding to prevent clipping across breakpoints; set minimum target size 44x44 px for social icons and small links; increase footer body text to 14\u201316 px for readability. Builds on expert notes about logo cut-off and small footer text.", "tags": "Significant"}, {"title": "Strengthen credibility metrics with readable qualifiers", "recommendation": "Problem: Labels under the big numbers (e.g., 2500+, 10K) are small and faint, reducing comprehension.
